Have problems with New Horizons add-on after installing ATI Catalyst9.1

Hi, I am using Windows Vista with ATI Radeon 2900 display card and having problems with New Horizons add-on after installing ATI Catalyst9.1 which is released on 1/29/2009.

After I had installed ATI Catalyst? 9.1 Display Driver for Windows Vista (32 bit), I opened shipsim.exe and error occured with APPCRASH by atiumdag.dll.

I have tried re-install the ship simulator, its no problem if i just install the ship simulator 2008 basic pack. The problem is occured after I install the ship simulator 2008 basic pack with New Horizons add-on (not Collector's Edition).

I think the problem is coming from ATI Catalyst? 9.1 Display Driver since everything comes normal after I rolling back to the Catalyst? 8.12 Display Driver for Windows Vista (32 bit) . Hope that the offical developers can solve the problems.....

Hate to tell you this, but it DOES work on Vista.  I tried it and it works fine.

Vista users having problems starting the game after updating, this worked for me:

#
A Channel or DLL error after an update is caused by the Windows Vista Virtual Store repository. Please try to run the program unregister.exe from the installation folder of Ship Simulator 2008 (default location C:\Program Files\Vstep\Ship Simulator2008\). This cleans the "Virtual store". If you are running Windows Vista and you are familiar with computers you can fix this by emptying the Virtual Store manually. To do so open your windows explorer window and proceed to the following folder: ?C:\Users\  \AppData\Local\VirtualStore\Program Files\?. Delete any file or folder inside the VSTEP folder. If this folder does not exist, your Virtual Store is already empty. Please note that you need to have the "Show hidden files and folder" option on, otherwise you will not see these folders.

ATTENTION WHEN UPDATING TO v1.42!

1. Install Ship Smiulator 2008

2. Launch it using this serial:
MFKMY-DDDZV-TBZ7V-FAFTZ-AT4MZ

3. Exit the game

4. Backup: Vstep\ShipSim2008\GUI\Main Menu\Do_Main_Menu_LicenseCheck.cgr

5. Install v1.42

6. Using the backed up file of Do_Main_Menu_LicenseCheck.cgr, copy & replace the v1.42 file

7. Enjoy!

To update the program to v1.4.2 go to http://www.shipsim.com/downloads/updates and download it from the site's Ship Simulator 2008-Updates tab.
Install the update and run using the following key:  dtzev-zdzzv-hvt72-4cftz-496ay (typed in lower case)
